bill_title: Commemorating the sixtieth anniversary of the founding of the South Dakota Capitol Club.

bill_versions.bill_text: A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Commemorating the sixtieth anniversary of the founding of the South Dakota Capitol Club. WHEREAS, the South Dakota Capitol Club, which is composed of the spouses of former and current legislators, governors, and constitutional officers, was founded during the 1937 legislative session to promote sociability and fellowship and fulfilled that nonpartisan commitment these sixty years; and WHEREAS, Capitol Club members have spent countless pleasant and productive hours doing volunteer work at hospitals and private charities, giving tours of the Capitol Building, assisting at the Cultural Heritage Center, and have assumed a number of financial responsibilities toward the betterment of the Capitol Building, the Governor's Mansion, and the Cultural Heritage Center; and WHEREAS, the Capitol Club members are dedicated to continuing their good works and high ideals into the next century continuing their motto, "Once a member, always a member": NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-second Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that the Legislature salute the South Dakota Capitol Club, express their deep appreciation for all that the members have accomplished during these sixty years, and offer their sincere gratitude for the devotion and love bestowed on them by the Capitol Club Members.
